channel.title: Ngc4519 on Suburban Backyard Astro Sights

item.title: A field of galaxies near M49
item.description: Here is an interesting field of galaxies in the constellation Virgo. The brightest is Messier 49, an elliptical galaxy. It is perhaps five times larger than our Milky Way galaxy and about 60 million light years distant. Since elliptical galaxies have no discernable structure, they just appear as fuzzy blobs.
